tit.e: "Terauke Seido" (The System To Force The Public To Become A Buddhist In The Edo Period)
"Terauke Seido" (the system of the Edo period that forced the public to become Buddhists)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので、クォーテーション、補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 寺請制度（てらうけせいど）とは、近世初期の1664年（寛文4年）に江戸幕府がキリスト教や不受不施派を禁制として、信徒に対し改宗を強制することを目的として制定された制度。
sen.e: "Terauke seido" was the system that was introduced in the early modern ages in 1664 by the Edo shogunate in order to ban the Christianity and the belief of "Fujufuse Group" (Not Receive and Not Give Group) and to force the believers to convert.

"Terauke seido" was a system introduced in 1664, during the early modern age, by the Edo shogunate in order to ban Christianity and the belief of the "Fujufuse Group (Not Receive and Not Give Group)," and to force the believers to convert.

sen.j: 具体的には、仏教の檀信徒であることの証明を寺院から請ける制度である。
sen.e: Concretely, it was the system that had all people get the certification of a temple to be a Buddhist.
Specifically, it was the system that had every person obtain the certification of their Buddhist faith from a temple.

sen.j: 寺請制度の確立によって民衆は、いずれかの寺院を菩提寺と定め、その檀家となる事を義務付けられた。
sen.e: The establishment of terauke seido forced the public to choose a certain temple as their "bodaiji" (family temple) and to become "danka" (supporter of the temple).

sen.j: 寺院では現在の戸籍に当たる宗門人別帳が作成され、旅行や住居の移動の際にはその証文（寺請証文）が必要とされた。
sen.e: Temples made up "shumon ninbetsu cho" (religious census register), which is today's family register, and the public needed to get a deed called "terauke shomon" (certificate of a Buddhist temple) when they set out on their travels or changed their residences.

sen.j: 各戸には仏壇が置かれ、法要の際には僧侶を招くという慣習が定まり、寺院に一定の信徒と収入を保証される形となった。
sen.e: With the system introduced, every household had its Buddhist altar and made it a custom to invite a Buddhist priest to its Buddhist memorial service, which assured the temple of its getting believers and money to a certain degree.

sen.j: 一方、寺院の側からすれば、檀信徒に対して教導を実施する責務を負わされることとなり、仏教教団が幕府の統治体制の一翼を担うこととなった。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the sytem obliged the temple to give religious instructions to its belivers, and had the Buddhist organizations play a role in the regime of the Edo shogunate.

sen.j: 仏教教団側が負った打撃は、本末制度との相乗効果により、上記にとどまらなかった。
sen.e: With the effect of terauke seido and "honmatsu seido" (the hierarchical system to control all temples) combined, the Buddhist organizations suffered other religious setbacks as well.

sen.j: すなわち、従来の教団活動の中で中心に位置していた門派・塔頭の機能を低下させられた。
sen.e: That is, their "monpa" (division of a Buddhist sect) and "tacchu" (minor temple), both of which played the central role in their Buddhist activities until then, were reduced in their organizational function.

sen.j: また他宗派の信徒への布教や新しい寺院の建立を禁止されその勢力の拡張が困難になった。
sen.e: In addition, they were banned from propagating their teachings to other sects' believers, and from constructing new temples, so it became difficult for them to extend their influence.
